content: Not bad, but let's try making Sarah seem less surprised to see him, and more unphased by the absurdity of his sudden appearance, because she is so accustomed to seeing and feeling unexplainable things, having delusions and an inappropriate sense of invulnerability. She is fantasizing about death, but somehow doesn't believe she even can die. She's in the frame of mind that she has something to prove to the universe about how wrong it is about what she's capable of. She is manic, psychotic, and has an odd manner of speech.
